de.intranda.digiverso.presentation.controller.imaging

Class IIIFPresentationAPIHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.intranda.digiverso.presentation.controller.imaging.IIIFPresentationAPIHandler

  • public class IIIFPresentationAPIHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates urls to IIIF Presentation api calls to get manifests, canvases, annotationLists or layers

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IIIFPresentationAPIHandler(java.lang.String servletPath, Configuration configuration) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAnnotationsUrl(java.lang.String pi, int pageOrder, java.lang.String annotationType)
      Returns a IIIF annotation list containing all annotations of the given type for the given page
      java.lang.String getCanvasUrl(java.lang.String pi, int pageOrder)
      Returns the IIIF canvas for the given page
      java.lang.String getCollectionUrl()
      Returns the url to a IIIF collection resource containing all top level collections for the field DC
      java.lang.String getCollectionUrl(java.lang.String field)
      Returns the url to a IIIF collection resource containing all top level collections for the given field
      java.lang.String getCollectionUrl(java.lang.String field, java.lang.String collection)
      Returns the url to a IIIF collection resource for the given collection name for the given field
      java.lang.String getLayerUrl(java.lang.String pi, java.lang.String annotationType)
      Returns a IIIF layer with all annotations of the given type within the work of the given pi
      java.lang.String getManifestUrl(java.lang.String pi)
      Returns the url to the manifest for the given pi
      java.lang.String getRangeUrl(java.lang.String pi, java.lang.String logId)
      Returns a IIIF range representing the structural element for the given PI and logid.

      • getRangeUrl

        public java.lang.String getRangeUrl(java.lang.String pi,
                                    java.lang.String logId)
                             throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Returns a IIIF range representing the structural element for the given PI and logid. If the logid is the logid of the work itself, The "CONTENT" range is returned, containing all topmost ranges but no canvases and no metadata
        Parameters:
        pi -
        logId -
        Returns:
        The IIIF range url
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException
